results.content:
Most of the stuff doesnt work for me and this is the first course where i have used more hours looking up stuff on the internet than on the course itself. 

Maybe it is just outdated, becuase i have the latest Eclipse, with EE tools etc. 

I did learn alot from this course and if it didnt give all kinds of errors constantly, then it would definatly be 5 stars from me.

results.content: I enjoyed this course, but there are two points:  1. Vaadin 10 came three months ago, and it's completely different, so it's like Vaadin 8 course is outdated; and 2. I think it could be shorter if you cut more moments like correcting typos, remembering the names of the classes etcetera. Thanks for the course!

results.content:
He's unsure, sloppy directions and he's omitted essential knowledge.
The code doesn't work.

I don't like a wake of failure. So I researched the subject revisited all installation, environment, reinstalled xampp, mysql. 

I learned enough over a day to realize he hadn't reviewed or revised his failure. So ... 

I went on to the next video and it was the first thing he fixed. This is sloppy. Work from a script! Way too much ad-hoc apologies. 

It's not what I expect from Eduonix or Udemy. 

I hope the instructor learns from this commentary and reflects on how best to instruct in the future.

I hope he REVIEWS & revises the delivery and adds this course because it has value. But please don't slow us down for his poor self-reflection.
